intro: Dregea faulknerae, commonly known as the Falkner's dregea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in racemes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
